text.content:
Age: 56  GENDER: FEMALE   RACE: WHITE 
MARITAL STATUS:  SEPARATED
 
 
 
                           CLINICAL HISTORY
 
PRESENTING CHIEF COMPLAINT: 
CHOLECYSTITS
 
 
HISTORY OF CURRENT ILLNESS:
Patient went to work after eating breakfast this morning.  Shortly after 
arriving at work, pt reports sudden onset of chest pain.  Due to DM, HTN, 
patient recieved a full cardiac workup in the ER this morning.  Trop neg, EKG 
neg.  On Ultrasound, patient was found to have cholecystitis.
 
Due to Elevated WBC, patient was started on pip/taz, and will be watched over 
night on the Observation ward.  Potential surgical candidate if not improved.
 
 
PAST PSYCHIATRIC HISTORY: 
The patient has history of depression.  She was also hospitalized earlier this 
year due to suicidal thoughts.
 
 
HISTORY OF SUICIDAL ACTS AND SELF-HARM: 
None
 
HISTORY OF VIOLENCE/ASSAULTING OTHERS/LEGAL PROBLEMS:
None
 
SUBSTANCE USE HISTORY: 
None
 
MILITARY HISTORY:
Branch:
Navy in the 1980's.
 
 
                          MEDICAL INFORMATION
 
(include response to medications, any medication side effects)
 a) CURRENT MEDICAL PROBLEMS: Cholesterol Elevation, Diabetes, Hypertension, 
Other (specify)
    Hypothyroidism
 
 b) CURRENT SIGNIFICANT PAIN PROBLEMS: as noted above
 
 c) NUTRITION ASSESSMENT: adequate
 d) CURRENT VA-PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS: 
 
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Inpatient Medications                                  Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN TAB,EC  81MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500 MG PO TID                   ACTIVE
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
5)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
7)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   MORPHINE INJ  2MG/0.5ML IV Q4H PRN pain                ACTIVE
9)   MORPHINE INJ  2MG/0.5ML IV Q2H PRN for CP              ACTIVE
10)  NAPROXEN TAB  500MG PO BID for pain                    ACTIVE
11)  NITROGLYCERIN 0.3MG TAB,SUBLINGUAL  1 TAB SL PRN       ACTIVE
       every 5 minutes x 3 for CP
12)  PIPERACILLIN/TAZOBACTAM INJ                            ACTIVE
       PIPERACILLIN/TAZOBACTAM 4.5 GM in SODIUM CHLORIDE
       0.9% 100 ML  INFUSE OVER 30 MINUTES refrigerate IV
       Q6H
13)  SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
14)  VENLAFAXINE CAP,SA  225MG PO DAILY                     ACTIVE
 
     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500 MG    ACTIVE
       BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH EVERY   ACTIVE
       DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       EVENING
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP TAKE THREE CAPSULES BY     ACTIVE
       MOUTH DAILY
 
23 Total Medications
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
 e) CURRENT NON-VA MEDICATIONS: 
    None 
 f) CURRENT NICOTINE AND CAFFEINE USE: 
    none
 
ALLERGIES AND ADVERSE DRUG REACTIONS: 
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
 
Anticipated discharge date: 23 hours.
text.author: ATTENDING,MEDICINE THREE
